greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fixed points of A327860: numbers n for which A003415(A276086(n)) = n.
comment: Applying A276086 to these terms gives the fixed points of A327859: 1, 2, 10, 15, 5005, ...
program: A327860(n) = { my(m=1, i=0, s=0, pr=1, nextpr); while((n>0), i=i+1; nextpr = prime(i)*pr; if((n%nextpr), my(e=((n%nextpr)/pr)); m *= (prime(i)^e); s += (e / prime(i)); n-=(n%nextpr)); pr=nextpr); (s*m); };
xref: After two initial terms (0 & 1), a subsequence of A328118.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 08 2019
